1$Condition: Bipolar Depression$10/2/2009 6:34:00 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I have taken many different medications over the last 8 years and this one has been the most effective by far.  It is one of the hardest on your body
column2: but it really works.  Maybe not how one thinks it should but it does level you out as much as possible.  Should help those who self medicated like I did as well ease that transition.
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$5$this drug has worked for my mania for 12 years.With a few side effects

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$3$5$I was on this medication for around 6 months. And it seemed to help others but didn't do what I expected it to do so I got off of it. I myself like Ativan & Strattera.

column1: 5$Condition: Bipolar Depression$3/26/2008 10:14:08 PM$Reviewer: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $2$2$4$I've been on this medication for a year now. If it weren't for the random addition and subtraction of various antidepressants/antipsychotics in that period
column2: I would have to say I see very little change in my behaviour.

column1: 6$Condition: Manic-Depression$1/10/2008 2:05:39 PM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$4$4$

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$5$I don't know if it is the disease or the medication
column3: but it seems that since I've been diagnosed and treated with bipolar disorder
column4: I'm no longer capable of having genuine feelings.  The only feelings I have are when I'm angry.  There is no sensitive
column5: loving person inside me anymore.  It seems like with all the advances in pharmacology
column6: someone could come up with something better.  And this is one of the older and in my experience best ones.  I've tried cymbalta
column11: I've used anti-depressants with it because otherwise I'm too depressed to even get out of bed.  The only thing I'm aware of that I haven't taken is Depakote.  I know the mind is a complicated thing
column12: but I wish there were another way besides drugs.  I've read something about a shock instrument placed at the base of your brain to shock the chemicals or transmitters
column13: or whatever to change the chemical embalance.  I'm not quite sure if I'm ready for this..but I'm really sick of the drugs.  I live through the drugs
column14: and I'm not living at all.

column1: 8$Condition: Bipolar Depression$11/28/2007 4:41:59 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $4$4$5$i am taking this along with Zyprexa and it works really well! I'm satisfied
column2: it is much better than Zyprexa alone
